bibl.title: Refections of Citizen Attitudes in Petitions from Roman Oxyrhynchus.
bibl.note: If the Roman government was oppressive during the first two centuries of its rule, its effect does not manifest itself in the attitudes of the people until the mid-second century.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the Sixteenth International Congress of Papyrology

bibl.seg: Morris Royce L.B., Refections of Citizen Attitudes in Petitions from Roman Oxyrhynchus.
Proceedings of the Sixteenth International Congress of Papyrology (Chico, 1981) pp. 363-370.
If the Roman government was oppressive during the first two centuries of its rule, its effect does not manifest itself in the attitudes of the people until the mid-second century.
